text: Calafat is a city in Dolj County, Romania. It is near the Danube River. This is across from the Bulgarian city of Vidin. Calafat was started in the 14th century by Genoese colonists. About 21,200 people lived in Calafat, as of 2000. ==International relations== ===Twin towns — Sister cities=== Calafat is twinned with: * Vidin, Bulgaria * Zaječar, Serbia * Duiven, Netherlands * Biñan, Philippines ==Other websites== Category:Municipalities of Romania Category:Cities in Dolj County
title: Calafat
